chunks.en: Pay a high bride price or propose to break up, sigh

I've been dating my girlfriend for three or four years, and our hometowns are very, very far apart.

Her mother said that the bride price would be 300,000, which is too much for me.

My girlfriend said she would try to get 100,000 back.

If we get married, the bride price alone will be 300,000, and how much will it cost with all the other expenses?

I thought about it, and the life after marriage would be impossible, it would definitely be a mess.

I am both angry at the other party's daughter-selling high bride price and sad about this doomed love affair.

I don't know what to do. My current mentality is to live one day at a time with her, continue to work hard to make money, and at the same time I am reluctant to break up, after all, we have been together for a long time.

We dated for a few years, spent some money, and when we talked about marriage, her mother asked for a 200,000 bride price that would not be returned. I broke up directly without hesitation.
She's an only child, she's just selling her daughter.
As long as you agree, there are other things waiting for you later.

A year after we broke up, she contacted me again, saying she didn't want the bride price and asked if we could buy a house in her city and get married. Dream on. If she suddenly lowered the price, I couldn't accept it even more. Isn't this asking me to take over?
Now my wife was introduced to me through a matchmaking arrangement. We got married after only 6 months of dating. The bride price was 40,000, and it was returned a few years after marriage.
It's okay, right? We don't spend money extravagantly, and we are very happy to have a daughter.
